Request Schema

<xs:schema attributeFormDefault="unqualified" elementFormDefault="qualified" xmlns:xs="http://www.w3.org/2001/XMLSchema">
  <xs:element name="routingGlobalConfig">
    <xs:complexType>
      <xs:sequence>
        <xs:element type="xs:string" name="routerId"/>
        <xs:element type="xs:string" name="ecmp"/>
        <xs:element name="logging">
          <xs:complexType>
            <xs:sequence>
              <xs:element type="xs:string" name="enable"/>
              <xs:element type="xs:string" name="logLevel"/>
            </xs:sequence>
          </xs:complexType>
        </xs:element>
        <xs:element name="ipPrefixes">
          <xs:complexType>
            <xs:sequence>
              <xs:element name="ipPrefix">
                <xs:complexType>
                  <xs:sequence>
                    <xs:element type="xs:string" name="name"/>
                    <xs:element type="xs:string" name="ipAddress"/>
                  </xs:sequence>
                </xs:complexType>
              </xs:element>
            </xs:sequence>
          </xs:complexType>
        </xs:element>
      </xs:sequence>
    </xs:complexType>
  </xs:element>
</xs:schema>

Request Example (application/xml)

<routingGlobalConfig>
  <routerId></routerId>
  <ecmp></ecmp>
  <logging>
    <enable></enable>
    <logLevel></logLevel>
  </logging>
  <ipPrefixes>
    <ipPrefix>
      <name></name>
      <ipAddress></ipAddress>
    </ipPrefix>
  </ipPrefixes>
</routingGlobalConfig>

GET /4.0/edges/{edgeId}/routing/config/global

Retrieve routing info from NSX Manager database (default route settings, static route configurations).

Working With OSPF Routing for NSX Edge

NSX Edge supports OSPF, an interior gateway protocol that routes IP packets only within a single routing domain. It gathers link state information from available routers and constructs a topology map of the network. The topology determines the routing table presented to the Internet Layer, which makes routing decisions based on the destination IP address found in IP packets.

OSPF routing policies provide a dynamic process of traffic load balancing between routes of equal cost. An OSPF network is divided into routing areas to optimize traffic. An area is a logical collection of OSPF networks, routers, and links that have the same area identification.

Areas are identified by an Area ID.

GET /4.0/edges/{edgeId}/routing/config/ospf

Retrieve OSPF configuration.

Method history:

Release Modification
6.2.3 Method updated. isis configuration section removed.
6.3.0 Method updated. Parameter defaultOriginate removed for logical router NSX Edges.
Parameter translateType7ToType5 added to OSPF section.

PUT /4.0/edges/{edgeId}/routing/config/ospf

Configure OSPF.

Method history:

Release Modification
6.2.3 Method updated. isis configuration section removed.
6.3.0 Method updated. Parameter defaultOriginate removed for logical router NSX Edges.
Parameter translateType7ToType5 added to OSPF section.

Request Schema

<xs:schema attributeFormDefault="unqualified" elementFormDefault="qualified" xmlns:xs="http://www.w3.org/2001/XMLSchema">
  <xs:element name="ospf">
    <xs:complexType>
      <xs:sequence>
        <xs:element type="xs:string" name="enabled"/>
        <xs:element name="ospfAreas">
          <xs:complexType>
            <xs:sequence>
              <xs:element name="ospfArea">
                <xs:complexType>
                  <xs:sequence>
                    <xs:element type="xs:string" name="areaId"/>
                    <xs:element type="xs:string" name="type"/>
                    <xs:element name="authentication">
                      <xs:complexType>
                        <xs:sequence>
                          <xs:element type="xs:string" name="type"/>
                          <xs:element type="xs:string" name="value"/>
                        </xs:sequence>
                      </xs:complexType>
                    </xs:element>
                  </xs:sequence>
                </xs:complexType>
              </xs:element>
            </xs:sequence>
          </xs:complexType>
        </xs:element>
        <xs:element name="ospfInterfaces">
          <xs:complexType>
            <xs:sequence>
              <xs:element name="ospfInterface">
                <xs:complexType>
                  <xs:sequence>
                    <xs:element type="xs:string" name="vnic"/>
                    <xs:element type="xs:string" name="areaId"/>
                    <xs:element type="xs:string" name="helloInterval"/>
                    <xs:element type="xs:string" name="deadInterval"/>
                    <xs:element type="xs:string" name="priority"/>
                    <xs:element type="xs:string" name="cost"/>
                  </xs:sequence>
                </xs:complexType>
              </xs:element>
            </xs:sequence>
          </xs:complexType>
        </xs:element>
        <xs:element name="redistribution">
          <xs:complexType>
            <xs:sequence>
              <xs:element type="xs:string" name="enabled"/>
              <xs:element name="rules">
                <xs:complexType>
                  <xs:sequence>
                    <xs:element name="rule">
                      <xs:complexType>
                        <xs:sequence>
                          <xs:element type="xs:string" name="prefixName"/>
                          <xs:element name="from">
                            <xs:complexType>
                              <xs:sequence>
                                <xs:element type="xs:string" name="ospf"/>
                                <xs:element type="xs:string" name="bgp"/>
                                <xs:element type="xs:string" name="static"/>
                                <xs:element type="xs:string" name="connected"/>
                              </xs:sequence>
                            </xs:complexType>
                          </xs:element>
                          <xs:element type="xs:string" name="action"/>
                        </xs:sequence>
                      </xs:complexType>
                    </xs:element>
                  </xs:sequence>
                </xs:complexType>
              </xs:element>
            </xs:sequence>
          </xs:complexType>
        </xs:element>
      </xs:sequence>
    </xs:complexType>
  </xs:element>
</xs:schema>

Request Example (application/xml)

<ospf>
  <enabled></enabled>
  <ospfAreas>
    <ospfArea>
      <areaId></areaId>
      <translateType7ToType5></translateType7ToType5>
      <type></type>
      <authentication>
        <type></type>
        <value></value>
      </authentication>
    </ospfArea>
  </ospfAreas>
  <ospfInterfaces>
    <ospfInterface>
      <vnic></vnic>
      <areaId></areaId>
      <helloInterval></helloInterval>
      <deadInterval></deadInterval>
      <priority></priority>
      <cost></cost>
    </ospfInterface>
  </ospfInterfaces>
  <redistribution>
    <enabled></enabled>
    <rules>
      <rule>
        <prefixName></prefixName>
        <from>
          <ospf></ospf>
          <bgp></bgp>
          <static></static>
          <connected></connected>
        </from>
        <action></action>
      </rule>
    </rules>
  </redistribution>
</ospf>

DELETE /4.0/edges/{edgeId}/routing/config/ospf

Working with Static and Default Routes

Configure static and default routes.

Request Schema

<xs:schema attributeFormDefault="unqualified" elementFormDefault="qualified" xmlns:xs="http://www.w3.org/2001/XMLSchema">
  <xs:element name="staticRouting">
    <xs:complexType>
      <xs:sequence>
        <xs:element name="staticRoutes">
          <xs:complexType>
            <xs:sequence>
              <xs:element name="route">
                <xs:complexType>
                  <xs:sequence>
                    <xs:element type="xs:string" name="description"/>
                    <xs:element type="xs:string" name="vnic"/>
                    <xs:element type="xs:string" name="network"/>
                    <xs:element type="xs:string" name="nextHop"/>
                    <xs:element type="xs:string" name="mtu"/>
                  </xs:sequence>
                </xs:complexType>
              </xs:element>
            </xs:sequence>
          </xs:complexType>
        </xs:element>
        <xs:element name="defaultRoute">
          <xs:complexType>
            <xs:sequence>
              <xs:element type="xs:string" name="description"/>
              <xs:element type="xs:string" name="vnic"/>
              <xs:element type="xs:string" name="gatewayAddress"/>
              <xs:element type="xs:string" name="mtu"/>
            </xs:sequence>
          </xs:complexType>
        </xs:element>
      </xs:sequence>
    </xs:complexType>
  </xs:element>
</xs:schema>

Request Example (application/xml)

<staticRouting>
  <staticRoutes>
    <route>
      <description></description>
      <vnic></vnic>
      <network></network>
      <nextHop></nextHop>
      <mtu></mtu>
    </route>
  </staticRoutes>
  <defaultRoute>
    <description></description>
    <vnic></vnic>
    <gatewayAddress></gatewayAddress>
    <mtu></mtu>
  </defaultRoute>
</staticRouting>

DELETE /4.0/edges/{edgeId}/routing/config/static

Delete both static and default routing config stored in the NSX Manager database.

Working With Active Client Sessions

Retrieve a list of active clients for the SSL VPN session.

Working With a Specific Active Client Session

URI Parameters

sessionID string required

Specified client session.

DELETE /4.0/edges/{edgeId}/sslvpn/activesessions/{sessionID}

Working with SSL VPN Users

PUT /4.0/edges/{edgeId}/sslvpn/auth/localusers/users

Update all users with the given list of users. If the user is present, it is updated. Otherwise, and new user is created. Existing users not included in the body are deleted.

Request Schema

<xs:schema attributeFormDefault="unqualified" elementFormDefault="qualified" xmlns:xs="http://www.w3.org/2001/XMLSchema">
  <xs:element name="users">
    <xs:complexType>
      <xs:sequence>
        <xs:element name="user">
          <xs:complexType>
            <xs:sequence>
              <xs:element type="xs:string" name="userId"/>
              <xs:element type="xs:string" name="password"/>
              <xs:element type="xs:string" name="firstName"/>
              <xs:element type="xs:string" name="lastName"/>
              <xs:element type="xs:string" name="description"/>
              <xs:element type="xs:string" name="disableUserAccount"/>
              <xs:element type="xs:string" name="passwordNeverExpires"/>
              <xs:element name="allowChangePassword">
                <xs:complexType>
                  <xs:sequence>
                    <xs:element type="xs:string" name="changePasswordOnNextLogin"/>
                  </xs:sequence>
                </xs:complexType>
              </xs:element>
            </xs:sequence>
          </xs:complexType>
        </xs:element>
      </xs:sequence>
    </xs:complexType>
  </xs:element>
</xs:schema>

Request Example (application/xml)

<users>
  <user>
    <userId></userId>
    <password></password>
    <firstName></firstName>
    <lastName></lastName>
    <description></description>
    <disableUserAccount></disableUserAccount>
    <passwordNeverExpires></passwordNeverExpires>
    <allowChangePassword>
      <changePasswordOnNextLogin></changePasswordOnNextLogin>
    </allowChangePassword>
  </user>
</users>

Working With SSL VPN

With SSL VPN-Plus, remote users can connect securely to private networks behind a NSX Edge gateway. Remote users can access servers and applications in the private networks.

POST /4.0/edges/{edgeId}/sslvpn/config

Enable or disable SSL VPN on the NSX Edge appliance.

Query Parameters

enableService boolean required

Set to true to enable, false to disable.

GET /4.0/edges/{edgeId}/sslvpn/config

Retrieve SSL VPN details.

PUT /4.0/edges/{edgeId}/sslvpn/config

Update the entire SSL VPN configuration to the specified NSX Edge in a single call.

DELETE /4.0/edges/{edgeId}/sslvpn/config

Delete the SSL VPN configurations on the Edge.

SSL VPN Advanced Configuration

GET /4.0/edges/{edgeId}/sslvpn/config/advancedconfig

Retrieve SSL VPN advanced configuration.

PUT /4.0/edges/{edgeId}/sslvpn/config/advancedconfig

Update SSL VPN advanced configuration.

Request Schema

<xs:schema attributeFormDefault="unqualified" elementFormDefault="qualified" xmlns:xs="http://www.w3.org/2001/XMLSchema">
  <xs:element name="advancedConfig">
    <xs:complexType>
      <xs:sequence>
        <xs:element type="xs:string" name="enableCompression"/>
        <xs:element type="xs:string" name="forceVirtualKeyboard"/>
        <xs:element type="xs:string" name="preventMultipleLogon"/>
        <xs:element type="xs:string" name="randomizeVirtualkeys"/>
        <xs:element name="timeout">
          <xs:complexType>
            <xs:sequence>
              <xs:element type="xs:string" name="forcedTimeout"/>
              <xs:element type="xs:string" name="sessionIdleTimeout"/>
            </xs:sequence>
          </xs:complexType>
        </xs:element>
        <xs:element type="xs:string" name="clientNotification"/>
        <xs:element type="xs:string" name="enableLogging"/>
      </xs:sequence>
    </xs:complexType>
  </xs:element>
</xs:schema>

Request Example (application/xml)

<advancedConfig>
  <enableCompression></enableCompression>
  <forceVirtualKeyboard></forceVirtualKeyboard>
  <preventMultipleLogon></preventMultipleLogon>
  <randomizeVirtualkeys></randomizeVirtualkeys>
  <timeout>
    <forcedTimeout></forcedTimeout>
    <sessionIdleTimeout></sessionIdleTimeout>
  </timeout>
  <clientNotification></clientNotification>
  <enableLogging></enableLogging>
</advancedConfig>

        <xs:element type="xs:string" name="userId"/>
        <xs:element type="xs:string" name="password"/>
        <xs:element type="xs:string" name="firstName"/>

        <xs:element type="xs:string" name="disableUserAccount"/>
        <xs:element type="xs:string" name="passwordNeverExpires"/>
        <xs:element name="allowChangePassword">
          <xs:complexType>
            <xs:sequence>
              <xs:element type="xs:string" name="changePasswordOnNextLogin"/>
            </xs:sequence>
          </xs:complexType>
        </xs:element>
      </xs:sequence>
    </xs:complexType>
  </xs:element>
</xs:schema>

    <xs:complexType>
      <xs:sequence>
        <xs:element type="xs:string" name="userId"/>
        <xs:element type="xs:string" name="password"/>
        <xs:element type="xs:string" name="firstName"/>
        <xs:element type="xs:string" name="lastName"/>
        <xs:element type="xs:string" name="description"/>
        <xs:element type="xs:string" name="disableUserAccount"/>
        <xs:element type="xs:string" name="passwordNeverExpires"/>
        <xs:element name="allowChangePassword">
          <xs:complexType>
            <xs:sequence>
              <xs:element type="xs:string" name="changePasswordOnNextLogin"/>
            </xs:sequence>
          </xs:complexType>
        </xs:element>
      </xs:sequence>
    </xs:complexType>
  </xs:element>
</xs:schema>

  <userId></userId>
  <password></password>
  <firstName></firstName>
  <lastName></lastName>
  <description></description>
  <disableUserAccount></disableUserAccount>
  <passwordNeverExpires></passwordNeverExpires>
  <allowChangePassword>
    <changePasswordOnNextLogin></changePasswordOnNextLogin>
  </allowChangePassword>
</user>

Working With a Specific Portal User

URI Parameters

userID string required

User ID.

GET /4.0/edges/{edgeId}/sslvpn/config/auth/localserver/users/{userID}

DELETE /4.0/edges/{edgeId}/sslvpn/config/auth/localserver/users/{userID}

Delete the specified user.

Working With Authentication Settings

GET /4.0/edges/{edgeId}/sslvpn/config/auth/settings

Retrieve information about authentication settings.

PUT /4.0/edges/{edgeId}/sslvpn/config/auth/settings

Update authentication settings for remote users. Specify username/password authentication, active directory, ldap, radius, client certificate based authentication.

Request Schema

<xs:schema attributeFormDefault="unqualified" elementFormDefault="qualified" xmlns:xs="http://www.w3.org/2001/XMLSchema">
  <xs:element name="authenticationConfig">
    <xs:complexType>
      <xs:sequence>
        <xs:element name="passwordAuthentication">
          <xs:complexType>
            <xs:sequence>
              <xs:element type="xs:string" name="authenticationTimeout"/>
              <xs:element name="primaryAuthServers">
                <xs:complexType>
                  <xs:sequence>
                    <xs:element name="com.vmware.vshield.edge.sslvpn.dto.LdapAuthServerDto">
                      <xs:complexType>
                        <xs:sequence>
                          <xs:element type="xs:string" name="ip"/>
                          <xs:element type="xs:string" name="port"/>
                          <xs:element type="xs:string" name="timeOut"/>
                          <xs:element type="xs:string" name="enableSsl"/>
                          <xs:element type="xs:string" name="searchBase"/>
                          <xs:element type="xs:string" name="bindDomainName"/>
                          <xs:element type="xs:string" name="bindPassword"/>
                          <xs:element type="xs:string" name="loginAttributeName"/>
                          <xs:element type="xs:string" name="searchFilter"/>
                          <xs:element type="xs:string" name="enabled"/>
                        </xs:sequence>
                      </xs:complexType>
                    </xs:element>
                    <xs:element name="com.vmware.vshield.edge.sslvpn.dto.RadiusAuthServerDto">
                      <xs:complexType>
                        <xs:sequence>
                          <xs:element type="xs:string" name="ip"/>
                          <xs:element type="xs:string" name="port"/>
                          <xs:element type="xs:string" name="timeOut"/>
                          <xs:element type="xs:string" name="secret"/>
                          <xs:element type="xs:string" name="nasIp"/>
                          <xs:element type="xs:string" name="retryCount"/>
                        </xs:sequence>
                      </xs:complexType>
                    </xs:element>
                    <xs:element name="com.vmware.vshield.edge.sslvpn.dto.LocalAuthServerDto">
                      <xs:complexType>
                        <xs:sequence>
                          <xs:element type="xs:string" name="enabled"/>
                          <xs:element name="passwordPolicy">
                            <xs:complexType>
                              <xs:sequence>
                                <xs:element type="xs:string" name="minLength"/>
                                <xs:element type="xs:string" name="maxLength"/>
                                <xs:element type="xs:string" name="minAlphabets"/>
                                <xs:element type="xs:string" name="minDigits"/>
                                <xs:element type="xs:string" name="minSpecialChar"/>
                                <xs:element type="xs:string" name="allowUserIdWithinPassword"/>
                                <xs:element type="xs:string" name="passwordLifeTime"/>
                                <xs:element type="xs:string" name="expiryNotification"/>
                              </xs:sequence>
                            </xs:complexType>
                          </xs:element>
                          <xs:element name="accountLockoutPolicy">
                            <xs:complexType>
                              <xs:sequence>
                                <xs:element type="xs:string" name="retryCount"/>
                                <xs:element type="xs:string" name="retryDuration"/>
                                <xs:element type="xs:string" name="lockoutDuration"/>
                              </xs:sequence>
                            </xs:complexType>
                          </xs:element>
                        </xs:sequence>
                      </xs:complexType>
                    </xs:element>
                    <xs:element name="com.vmware.vshield.edge.sslvpn.dto.RsaAuthServerDto">
                      <xs:complexType>
                        <xs:sequence>
                          <xs:element type="xs:string" name="timeOut"/>
                          <xs:element type="xs:string" name="sourceIp"/>
                        </xs:sequence>
                      </xs:complexType>
                    </xs:element>
                  </xs:sequence>
                </xs:complexType>
              </xs:element>
              <xs:element name="secondaryAuthServer">
                <xs:complexType>
                  <xs:sequence>
                    <xs:element name="com.vmware.vshield.edge.sslvpn.dto.AdAuthServerDto">
                      <xs:complexType>
                        <xs:sequence>
                          <xs:element type="xs:string" name="ip"/>
                          <xs:element type="xs:string" name="port"/>
                          <xs:element type="xs:string" name="timeOut"/>
                          <xs:element type="xs:string" name="enableSsl"/>
                          <xs:element type="xs:string" name="searchBase"/>
                          <xs:element type="xs:string" name="bindDomainName"/>
                          <xs:element type="xs:string" name="bindPassword"/>
                          <xs:element type="xs:string" name="loginAttributeName"/>
                          <xs:element type="xs:string" name="searchFilter"/>
                          <xs:element type="xs:string" name="terminateSessionOnAuthFails"/>
                          <xs:element type="xs:string" name="enabled"/>
                        </xs:sequence>
                      </xs:complexType>
                    </xs:element>
                  </xs:sequence>
                </xs:complexType>
              </xs:element>
            </xs:sequence>
          </xs:complexType>
        </xs:element>
      </xs:sequence>
    </xs:complexType>
  </xs:element>
</xs:schema>

Request Example (application/xml)

<authenticationConfig>
  <passwordAuthentication>
  <authenticationTimeout></authenticationTimeout>
    <primaryAuthServers>
      <com.vmware.vshield.edge.sslvpn.dto.LdapAuthServerDto>
        <ip></ip>
        <port></port>
        <timeOut></timeOut>
        <enableSsl></enableSsl>
        <searchBase></searchBase>
        <bindDomainName></bindDomainName>
        <bindPassword></bindPassword>
        <loginAttributeName></loginAttributeName>
        <searchFilter></searchFilter>
        <enabled></enabled>
      </com.vmware.vshield.edge.sslvpn.dto.LdapAuthServerDto>
      <com.vmware.vshield.edge.sslvpn.dto.RadiusAuthServerDto>
        <ip></ip>
        <port></port>
        <timeOut></timeOut>
        <secret></secret>
        <nasIp></nasIp>
        <retryCount></retryCount>
      </com.vmware.vshield.edge.sslvpn.dto.RadiusAuthServerDto>
      <com.vmware.vshield.edge.sslvpn.dto.LocalAuthServerDto>
        <enabled></enabled>
        <passwordPolicy>
          <minLength></minLength>
          <maxLength></maxLength>
          <minAlphabets></minAlphabets>
          <minDigits></minDigits>
          <minSpecialChar></minSpecialChar>
          <allowUserIdWithinPassword></allowUserIdWithinPassword>
          <passwordLifeTime></passwordLifeTime>
          <expiryNotification></expiryNotification>
        </passwordPolicy>
        <accountLockoutPolicy>
          <retryCount></retryCount>
          <retryDuration></retryDuration>
          <lockoutDuration></lockoutDuration>
        </accountLockoutPolicy>
      </com.vmware.vshield.edge.sslvpn.dto.LocalAuthServerDto>
      <com.vmware.vshield.edge.sslvpn.dto.RsaAuthServerDto>
        <timeOut></timeOut>
        <sourceIp></sourceIp>
      </com.vmware.vshield.edge.sslvpn.dto.RsaAuthServerDto>
    </primaryAuthServers>
    <secondaryAuthServer>
      <com.vmware.vshield.edge.sslvpn.dto.AdAuthServerDto>
        <ip>1.1.1.1</ip>
        <port>90</port>
        <timeOut>20</timeOut>
        <enableSsl>false</enableSsl>
        <searchBase>searchbasevalue</searchBase>
        <bindDomainName>binddnvalue</bindDomainName>
        <bindPassword>password</bindPassword>
        <loginAttributeName>cain</loginAttributeName>
        <searchFilter>found</searchFilter>
        <terminateSessionOnAuthFails>false</terminateSessionOnAuthFails>
        <enabled>true</enabled>
      </com.vmware.vshield.edge.sslvpn.dto.AdAuthServerDto>
    </secondaryAuthServer>
  </passwordAuthentication>
</authenticationConfig>

Working With the RSA Config File

POST /4.0/edges/{edgeId}/sslvpn/config/auth/settings/rsaconfigfile

Upload RSA config file (See "Generate the Authentication Manager Configuration File" section of the RSA Authentication Manager Administrator's guide for instructions on how to configure and download the RSA config file from RSA Authentication Manager).

Working With Network Extension Client Parameters

PUT /4.0/edges/{edgeId}/sslvpn/config/client/networkextension/clientconfig

Set advanced parameters for full access client configurations, such as whether client should auto-reconnect in case of network failures or network unavailability, or whether the client should be uninstalled after logout.

Request Schema

<xs:schema attributeFormDefault="unqualified" elementFormDefault="qualified" xmlns:xs="http://www.w3.org/2001/XMLSchema">
  <xs:element name="clientConfiguration">
    <xs:complexType>
      <xs:sequence>
        <xs:element type="xs:string" name="autoReconnect"/>
        <xs:element name="fullTunnel">
          <xs:complexType>
            <xs:sequence>
              <xs:element type="xs:string" name="excludeLocalSubnets"/>
              <xs:element type="xs:string" name="gatewayIp"/>
            </xs:sequence>
          </xs:complexType>
        </xs:element>
        <xs:element type="xs:string" name="upgradeNotification"/>
      </xs:sequence>
    </xs:complexType>
  </xs:element>
</xs:schema>

Request Example (application/xml)

<clientConfiguration>
  <autoReconnect>true</autoReconnect>
  <fullTunnel>
    <excludeLocalSubnets>false</excludeLocalSubnets>
    <gatewayIp>10.112.243.11</gatewayIp>
  </fullTunnel>
  <upgradeNotification>false</upgradeNotification>
</clientConfiguration>

GET /4.0/edges/{edgeId}/sslvpn/config/client/networkextension/clientconfig

Retrieve client configuration.

Working With SSL VPN Client Installation Packages

POST /4.0/edges/{edgeId}/sslvpn/config/client/networkextension/installpackages

Creates setup executables (installers) for full access network clients. These setup binaries are later downloaded by remote clients and installed on their systems. The primary parameters needed to configure this setup are hostname of the gateway, and its port and a profile name which is shown to the user to identify this connection. Administrator can also set few other parameters such as whether to automatically start the application on windows login, hide the system tray icon etc.

Request Schema

<xs:schema attributeFormDefault="unqualified" elementFormDefault="qualified" xmlns:xs="http://www.w3.org/2001/XMLSchema">
  <xs:element name="clientInstallPackage">
    <xs:complexType>
      <xs:sequence>
        <xs:element type="xs:string" name="profileName"/>
        <xs:element name="gatewayList">
          <xs:complexType>
            <xs:sequence>
              <xs:element name="gateway">
                <xs:complexType>
                  <xs:sequence>
                    <xs:element type="xs:string" name="hostName"/>
                    <xs:element type="xs:string" name="port"/>
                  </xs:sequence>
                </xs:complexType>
              </xs:element>
            </xs:sequence>
          </xs:complexType>
        </xs:element>
        <xs:element type="xs:string" name="startClientOnLogon"/>
        <xs:element type="xs:string" name="hideSystrayIcon"/>
        <xs:element type="xs:string" name="rememberPassword"/>
        <xs:element type="xs:string" name="silentModeOperation"/>
        <xs:element type="xs:string" name="silentModeInstallation"/>
        <xs:element type="xs:string" name="hideNetworkAdaptor"/>
        <xs:element type="xs:string" name="createDesktopIcon"/>
        <xs:element type="xs:string" name="enforceServerSecurityCertValidation"/>
        <xs:element type="xs:string" name="createLinuxClient"/>
        <xs:element type="xs:string" name="createMacClient"/>
        <xs:element type="xs:string" name="description"/>
        <xs:element type="xs:string" name="enabled"/>
      </xs:sequence>
    </xs:complexType>
  </xs:element>
</xs:schema>

Request Example (application/xml)

<clientInstallPackage>
  <profileName></profileName>
  <gatewayList>
    <gateway>
      <hostName></hostName>
      <port></port>
    </gateway>
  </gatewayList>
  <startClientOnLogon></startClientOnLogon>
  <hideSystrayIcon></hideSystrayIcon>
  <rememberPassword></rememberPassword>
  <silentModeOperation></silentModeOperation>
  <silentModeInstallation></silentModeInstallation>
  <hideNetworkAdaptor></hideNetworkAdaptor>
  <createDesktopIcon></createDesktopIcon>
  <enforceServerSecurityCertValidation></enforceServerSecurityCertValidation>
  <createLinuxClient></createLinuxClient>
  <createMacClient></createMacClient>
  <description></description>
  <enabled></enabled>
</clientInstallPackage>

GET /4.0/edges/{edgeId}/sslvpn/config/client/networkextension/installpackages

Retrieve information about all installation packages.

PUT /4.0/edges/{edgeId}/sslvpn/config/client/networkextension/installpackages

Update all installation packages with the given list. If the package is present, it is updated; otherwise a new installation package is created. Existing packages not included in the body are deleted.

DELETE /4.0/edges/{edgeId}/sslvpn/config/client/networkextension/installpackages

Delete all client installation packages.

Working With a Specific SSL VPN Client Installation Package

URI Parameters

packageID string required

Specified installation package ID.

GET /4.0/edges/{edgeId}/sslvpn/config/client/networkextension/installpackages/{packageID}

Get information about the specified installation package.

PUT /4.0/edges/{edgeId}/sslvpn/config/client/networkextension/installpackages/{packageID}

Modify the specified installation package.

Request Schema

<xs:schema attributeFormDefault="unqualified" elementFormDefault="qualified" xmlns:xs="http://www.w3.org/2001/XMLSchema">
  <xs:element name="clientInstallPackage">
    <xs:complexType>
      <xs:sequence>
        <xs:element type="xs:string" name="profileName"/>
        <xs:element name="gatewayList">
          <xs:complexType>
            <xs:sequence>
              <xs:element name="gateway">
                <xs:complexType>
                  <xs:sequence>
                    <xs:element type="xs:string" name="hostName"/>
                    <xs:element type="xs:string" name="port"/>
                  </xs:sequence>
                </xs:complexType>
              </xs:element>
            </xs:sequence>
          </xs:complexType>
        </xs:element>
        <xs:element type="xs:string" name="startClientOnLogon"/>
        <xs:element type="xs:string" name="hideSystrayIcon"/>
        <xs:element type="xs:string" name="rememberPassword"/>
        <xs:element type="xs:string" name="silentModeOperation"/>
        <xs:element type="xs:string" name="silentModeInstallation"/>
        <xs:element type="xs:string" name="hideNetworkAdaptor"/>
        <xs:element type="xs:string" name="createDesktopIcon"/>
        <xs:element type="xs:string" name="enforceServerSecurityCertValidation"/>
        <xs:element type="xs:string" name="createLinuxClient"/>
        <xs:element type="xs:string" name="createMacClient"/>
        <xs:element type="xs:string" name="description"/>
        <xs:element type="xs:string" name="enabled"/>
      </xs:sequence>
    </xs:complexType>
  </xs:element>
</xs:schema>

Request Example (application/xml)

<clientInstallPackage>
  <profileName></profileName>
  <gatewayList>
    <gateway>
      <hostName></hostName>
      <port></port>
    </gateway>
  </gatewayList>
  <startClientOnLogon></startClientOnLogon>
  <hideSystrayIcon></hideSystrayIcon>
  <rememberPassword></rememberPassword>
  <silentModeOperation></silentModeOperation>
  <silentModeInstallation></silentModeInstallation>
  <hideNetworkAdaptor></hideNetworkAdaptor>
  <createDesktopIcon></createDesktopIcon>
  <enforceServerSecurityCertValidation></enforceServerSecurityCertValidation>
  <createLinuxClient></createLinuxClient>
  <createMacClient></createMacClient>
  <description></description>
  <enabled></enabled>
</clientInstallPackage>

DELETE /4.0/edges/{edgeId}/sslvpn/config/client/networkextension/installpackages/{packageID}

Delete the specified installation package.

Working With IP Pools for SSL VPN

POST /4.0/edges/{edgeId}/sslvpn/config/client/networkextension/ippools

Create an IP pool.

Request Schema

<xs:schema attributeFormDefault="unqualified" elementFormDefault="qualified" xmlns:xs="http://www.w3.org/2001/XMLSchema">
  <xs:element name="ipAddressPool">
    <xs:complexType>
      <xs:sequence>
        <xs:element type="xs:string" name="description"/>
        <xs:element type="xs:string" name="ipRange"/>
        <xs:element type="xs:string" name="netmask"/>
        <xs:element type="xs:string" name="gateway"/>
        <xs:element type="xs:string" name="primaryDns"/>
        <xs:element type="xs:string" name="secondaryDns"/>
        <xs:element type="xs:string" name="dnsSuffix"/>
        <xs:element type="xs:string" name="winsServer"/>
        <xs:element type="xs:string" name="enabled"/>
      </xs:sequence>
    </xs:complexType>
  </xs:element>
</xs:schema>

Request Example (application/xml)

<ipAddressPool>
  <description></description>
  <ipRange></ipRange>
  <netmask></netmask>
  <gateway></gateway>
  <primaryDns></primaryDns>
  <secondaryDns></secondaryDns>
  <dnsSuffix></dnsSuffix>
  <winsServer></winsServer>
  <enabled></enabled>
</ipAddressPool>

GET /4.0/edges/{edgeId}/sslvpn/config/client/networkextension/ippools

Retrieve all IP pools configured on SSL VPN.

PUT /4.0/edges/{edgeId}/sslvpn/config/client/networkextension/ippools

Update all IP pools with the given list of pools. If the pool is present, it is updated; otherwise, a new pool is created. Existing pools not in the body are deleted.

Request Schema

<xs:schema attributeFormDefault="unqualified" elementFormDefault="qualified" xmlns:xs="http://www.w3.org/2001/XMLSchema">
  <xs:element name="ipAddressPool">
    <xs:complexType>
      <xs:sequence>
        <xs:element type="xs:string" name="description"/>
        <xs:element type="xs:string" name="ipRange"/>
        <xs:element type="xs:string" name="netmask"/>
        <xs:element type="xs:string" name="gateway"/>
        <xs:element type="xs:string" name="primaryDns"/>
        <xs:element type="xs:string" name="secondaryDns"/>
        <xs:element type="xs:string" name="dnsSuffix"/>
        <xs:element type="xs:string" name="winsServer"/>
        <xs:element type="xs:string" name="enabled"/>
      </xs:sequence>
    </xs:complexType>
  </xs:element>
</xs:schema>

Request Example (application/xml)

<ipAddressPool>
  <description></description>
  <ipRange></ipRange>
  <netmask></netmask>
  <gateway></gateway>
  <primaryDns></primaryDns>
  <secondaryDns></secondaryDns>
  <dnsSuffix></dnsSuffix>
  <winsServer></winsServer>
  <enabled></enabled>
</ipAddressPool>

DELETE /4.0/edges/{edgeId}/sslvpn/config/client/networkextension/ippools

Delete all IP pools configured on SSL VPN

Working With a Specific IP Pool for SSL VPN

URI Parameters

ippoolID string required

Specified IP pool ID.

GET /4.0/edges/{edgeId}/sslvpn/config/client/networkextension/ippools/{ippoolID}

Retrieve details of specified IP pool.

PUT /4.0/edges/{edgeId}/sslvpn/config/client/networkextension/ippools/{ippoolID}

Update specified IP pool.

Request Example (application/xml)

<ipAddressPool>
  <description>description</description>
  <ipRange>10.112.243.11-10.112.243.57</ipRange>
  <netmask>255.0.0.0</netmask>
  <gateway>192.168.1.1</gateway>
  <primaryDns>192.168.10.1</primaryDns>
  <secondaryDns>4.2.2.2</secondaryDns>
  <dnsSuffix></dnsSuffix>
  <winsServer>10.112.243.201</winsServer>
  <enabled>true</enabled>
</ipAddressPool>

DELETE /4.0/edges/{edgeId}/sslvpn/config/client/networkextension/ippools/{ippoolID}

Delete the specified IP pool.

Working With Private Networks

You can use a private network to expose to remote users over SSL VPN tunnel.

POST /4.0/edges/{edgeId}/sslvpn/config/client/networkextension/privatenetworks

Configure a private network.

Request Schema

<xs:schema attributeFormDefault="unqualified" elementFormDefault="qualified" xmlns:xs="http://www.w3.org/2001/XMLSchema">
  <xs:element name="privateNetwork">
    <xs:complexType>
      <xs:sequence>
        <xs:element type="xs:string" name="description"/>
        <xs:element type="xs:string" name="network"/>
        <xs:element name="sendOverTunnel">
          <xs:complexType>
            <xs:sequence>
              <xs:element type="xs:string" name="ports"/>
              <xs:element type="xs:string" name="optimize"/>
            </xs:sequence>
          </xs:complexType>
        </xs:element>
        <xs:element type="xs:string" name="enabled"/>
      </xs:sequence>
    </xs:complexType>
  </xs:element>
</xs:schema>

Request Example (application/xml)

<privateNetwork>
  <description></description>
  <network></network>
  <sendOverTunnel>
    <ports></ports>
    <optimize></optimize>
  </sendOverTunnel>
  <enabled></enabled>
</privateNetwork>

GET /4.0/edges/{edgeId}/sslvpn/config/client/networkextension/privatenetworks

Retrieve all private network profiles in the SSL VPN instance.

PUT /4.0/edges/{edgeId}/sslvpn/config/client/networkextension/privatenetworks

Update all private network configs of NSX Edge with the given list of private network configs. If the config is present, it is updated; otherwise, a new private network config is created. Existing configs not included in the call body are deleted.

DELETE /4.0/edges/{edgeId}/sslvpn/config/client/networkextension/privatenetworks

Delete all private networks from the SSL VPN instance.

Working With a Specific Private Network

URI Parameters

networkID string required

Specified private network

GET /4.0/edges/{edgeId}/sslvpn/config/client/networkextension/privatenetworks/{networkID}

Retrieve the specified private network in the SSL VPN service.

PUT /4.0/edges/{edgeId}/sslvpn/config/client/networkextension/privatenetworks/{networkID}

Update the specified private network in the SSL VPN service.

Request Schema

<xs:schema attributeFormDefault="unqualified" elementFormDefault="qualified" xmlns:xs="http://www.w3.org/2001/XMLSchema">
  <xs:element name="privateNetwork">
    <xs:complexType>
      <xs:sequence>
        <xs:element type="xs:string" name="description"/>
        <xs:element type="xs:string" name="network"/>
        <xs:element name="sendOverTunnel">
          <xs:complexType>
            <xs:sequence>
              <xs:element type="xs:string" name="ports"/>
              <xs:element type="xs:string" name="optimize"/>
            </xs:sequence>
          </xs:complexType>
        </xs:element>
        <xs:element type="xs:string" name="enabled"/>
      </xs:sequence>
    </xs:complexType>
  </xs:element>
</xs:schema>

Request Example (application/xml)

<privateNetwork>
  <description></description>
  <network></network>
  <sendOverTunnel>
    <ports></ports>
    <optimize></optimize>
  </sendOverTunnel>
  <enabled></enabled>
</privateNetwork>

DELETE /4.0/edges/{edgeId}/sslvpn/config/client/networkextension/privatenetworks/{networkID}

Delete private network

Working With Portal Layout

GET /4.0/edges/{edgeId}/sslvpn/config/layout

Retrieve layout configuration.

PUT /4.0/edges/{edgeId}/sslvpn/config/layout

Update the portal layout.

Request Schema

<xs:schema attributeFormDefault="unqualified" elementFormDefault="qualified" xmlns:xs="http://www.w3.org/2001/XMLSchema">
  <xs:element name="layout">
    <xs:complexType>
      <xs:sequence>
        <xs:element type="xs:string" name="portalTitle"/>
        <xs:element type="xs:string" name="companyName"/>
        <xs:element type="xs:string" name="logoBackgroundColor"/>
        <xs:element type="xs:string" name="titleColor"/>
        <xs:element type="xs:string" name="topFrameColor"/>
        <xs:element type="xs:string" name="menuBarColor"/>
        <xs:element type="xs:string" name="rowAlternativeColor"/>
        <xs:element type="xs:string" name="bodyColor"/>
        <xs:element type="xs:string" name="rowColor"/>
      </xs:sequence>
    </xs:complexType>
  </xs:element>
</xs:schema>

Request Example (application/xml)

<layout>
  <portalTitle></portalTitle>
  <companyName></companyName>
  <logoBackgroundColor></logoBackgroundColor>
  <titleColor></titleColor>
  <topFrameColor></topFrameColor>
  <menuBarColor></menuBarColor>
  <rowAlternativeColor></rowAlternativeColor>
  <bodyColor></bodyColor>
  <rowColor></rowColor>
</layout>

Working With Image Files for SSL VPN

URI Parameters

imageType string required

Type of image to upload. Choice of portallogo, phatbanner, connecticon, disconnecticon, desktopicon, or erroricon.

POST /4.0/edges/{edgeId}/sslvpn/config/layout/images/{imageType}

Upload images for use with SSL VPN portal and client.

You can upload a logo to use in the SSL VPN portal, and a banner and icons to use in the SSL VPN client.

You must upload the image files using the form-data content-type. Consult the documentation for your REST client for instructions.

Do not set other Content-type headers in your request, for example, Content-type: application/xml.

When you upload a file as form-data, you must provide a key and a value for the file. See the table below for the form-data key to use for each image type. The value is the path to the image file.

Image Type form-data key Image format requirements
portallogo layoutFile n/a
phatbanner banner bmp
connecticon icon ico
disconnecticon icon ico
erroricon icon ico
desktopicon icon ico

Example using curl

/usr/bin/curl -v -k -i -F layoutFile=@/tmp/portalLogo.jpg -H 'Authorization: Basic YWRtaW46ZGXXXXXXXX==' 
https://192.168.110.42/api/4.0/edges/edge-3/sslvpn/config/layout/images/portallogo

Working with Logon and Logoff Scripts for SSL VPN

POST /4.0/edges/{edgeId}/sslvpn/config/script

Configure parameters associated with the uploaded script file.

Request Schema

<xs:schema attributeFormDefault="unqualified" elementFormDefault="qualified" xmlns:xs="http://www.w3.org/2001/XMLSchema">
  <xs:element name="logonLogoffScript">
    <xs:complexType>
      <xs:sequence>
        <xs:element type="xs:string" name="scriptFileId"/>
        <xs:element type="xs:string" name="type"/>
        <xs:element type="xs:string" name="description"/>
        <xs:element type="xs:string" name="enabled"/>
      </xs:sequence>
    </xs:complexType>
  </xs:element>
</xs:schema>

Request Example (application/xml)

<logonLogoffScript>
  <scriptFileId></scriptFileId>
  <type></type>
  <description></description>
  <enabled></enabled>
</logonLogoffScript>

GET /4.0/edges/{edgeId}/sslvpn/config/script

Retrieve all script configurations.

PUT /4.0/edges/{edgeId}/sslvpn/config/script

Update all script configurations with the given list of configurations. If the config is present, its is updated; otherwise, a new config is created. Existing configs not included in the body are deleted.

Request Schema

<xs:schema attributeFormDefault="unqualified" elementFormDefault="qualified" xmlns:xs="http://www.w3.org/2001/XMLSchema">
  <xs:element name="logonLogoffScript">
    <xs:complexType>
      <xs:sequence>
        <xs:element type="xs:string" name="scriptFileId"/>
        <xs:element type="xs:string" name="type"/>
        <xs:element type="xs:string" name="description"/>
        <xs:element type="xs:string" name="enabled"/>
      </xs:sequence>
    </xs:complexType>
  </xs:element>
</xs:schema>

Request Example (application/xml)

<logonLogoffScript>
  <scriptFileId></scriptFileId>
  <type></type>
  <description></description>
  <enabled></enabled>
</logonLogoffScript>

DELETE /4.0/edges/{edgeId}/sslvpn/config/script

Delete all script configurations

Uploading Script Files for SSL VPN

POST /4.0/edges/{edgeId}/sslvpn/config/script/file/

You can add multiple login or logoff scripts. For example, you can bind a login script for starting Internet Explorer with gmail.com. When the remote user logs in to the SSL client, Internet Explorer opens up gmail.com. This method returns a scriptFileId which can be used to update parameters associated with the script file.

You must upload the script files using the form-data content-type. Consult the documentation for your REST client for instructions.

Do not set other Content-type headers in your request, for example, Content-type: application/xml.

When you upload a file as form-data, you must provide a key and a value for the file. The key is file, and the value is the location of the script file.

Example using curl

/usr/bin/curl -v -k -i -F file=@/tmp/script.sh -H 'Authorization: Basic YWRtaW46ZGXXXXXXXX=='
https://192.168.110.42/api/4.0/edges/edge-3/sslvpn/config/script/file/

Working With Uploaded Script Files

URI Parameters

fileID string required

Specified script file.

GET /4.0/edges/{edgeId}/sslvpn/config/script/{fileID}

Retrieve parameters associated with the specified script file.

PUT /4.0/edges/{edgeId}/sslvpn/config/script/{fileID}

Update parameters associated with the specified script file.

Request Schema

<xs:schema attributeFormDefault="unqualified" elementFormDefault="qualified" xmlns:xs="http://www.w3.org/2001/XMLSchema">
  <xs:element name="logonLogoffScript">
    <xs:complexType>
      <xs:sequence>
        <xs:element type="xs:string" name="scriptFileId"/>
        <xs:element type="xs:string" name="type"/>
        <xs:element type="xs:string" name="description"/>
        <xs:element type="xs:string" name="enabled"/>
      </xs:sequence>
    </xs:complexType>
  </xs:element>
</xs:schema>

Request Example (application/xml)

<logonLogoffScript>
  <scriptFileId></scriptFileId>
  <type></type>
  <description></description>
  <enabled></enabled>
</logonLogoffScript>

DELETE /4.0/edges/{edgeId}/sslvpn/config/script/{fileID}

Delete script parameters.

Working With SSL VPN Server

GET /4.0/edges/{edgeId}/sslvpn/config/server

Retrieve server settings.

PUT /4.0/edges/{edgeId}/sslvpn/config/server

Update server settings.

Request Schema

<xs:schema attributeFormDefault="unqualified" elementFormDefault="qualified" xmlns:xs="http://www.w3.org/2001/XMLSchema">
  <xs:element name="serverSettings">
    <xs:complexType>
      <xs:sequence>
        <xs:element name="serverAddresses">
          <xs:complexType>
            <xs:sequence>
              <xs:element type="xs:string" name="ipAddress"/>
            </xs:sequence>
          </xs:complexType>
        </xs:element>
        <xs:element type="xs:string" name="port"/>
        <xs:element type="xs:string" name="certificateId"/>
        <xs:element name="sslVersionList">
          <xs:complexType>
            <xs:sequence>
              <xs:element type="xs:string" name="version"/>
            </xs:sequence>
          </xs:complexType>
        </xs:element>
      </xs:sequence>
    </xs:complexType>
  </xs:element>
</xs:schema>

Request Example (application/xml)

<serverSettings>
  <serverAddresses>
    <ipAddress>10.112.243.109</ipAddress>
  </serverAddresses>
  <port>443</port>
  <certificateId>certificate-1</certificateId>
  <cipherList>
    <cipher>AES128-SHA</cipher>
    <cipher>AES256-SHA</cipher>
  </cipherList>
</serverSettings>

Working With Interface Dashboard Statistics

GET /4.0/edges/{edgeId}/statistics/dashboard/interface

Retrieves dashboard statistics between the specified start and end times. When start and end time are not specified, all statistics since the Edge deployed are displayed. When no end time is specified, the current Edge Manager time is set as endTime. Each record has the stats of 5 minutes granularity.

Query Parameters

interval string required

Specify a start and end time range in seconds.

Working With Tunnel Traffic Dashboard Statistics

GET /4.0/edges/{edgeId}/statistics/dashboard/ipsec

Retrieve tunnel traffic statistics for specified time interval.

Query Parameters

interval string

Specify a range; can be 1 - 60 minutes, or oneDay, oneWeek, oneMonth, or oneYear. Default is 60 minutes.

Working With SSL VPN Dashboard Statistics

GET /4.0/edges/{edgeId}/statistics/dashboard/sslvpn

Retrieve SSL VPN statistics on the specified NSX Edge.

Query Parameters

interval string

Specify a range; can be 1 - 60 minutes, or oneDay, oneWeek, oneMonth, or oneYear. Default is 60 minutes.

Working With Interface Statistics

GET /4.0/edges/{edgeId}/statistics/interfaces

Retrieve interface statistics.

Working With Internal Interface Statistics

GET /4.0/edges/{edgeId}/statistics/interfaces/internal

Retrieve internal interface statistics.

Working With Uplink Interface Statistics

GET /4.0/edges/{edgeId}/statistics/interfaces/uplink

Retrieve uplink interface statistics.

Working With NSX Edge Status

GET /4.0/edges/{edgeId}/status

Retrieve the status of the specified Edge.

The edgeStatus has the following possible states:

  • GREEN: Health checks are successful, status is good.
  • YELLOW: Intermittent health check failure. If health check fails for five consecutive times for all appliances, status will turn RED.
  • GREY: unknown status.
  • RED: None of the appliances for this NSX Edge are in a serving state.

Query Parameters

getlatest boolean

If true: retrieve the status live from NSX Edge.
If false: retrieve the latest available status from database.

detailed boolean

If true: retrieve detailed status per feature.
If false: retrieve aggregated summary of status per feature.

preRulesStatus boolean

If true: retreive detailed output for pre rules in addition to the regular output.

Responses

200 OK

Response Example (application/xml) 
<edgeStatus>
  <timestamp>1343739873000</timestamp>
  <systemStatus>good</systemStatus>
  <activeVseHaIndex>0</activeVseHaIndex>
  <edgeStatus>GREEN</edgeStatus>
  <publishStatus>APPLIED</publishStatus> 
  <version>8</version>
  <edgeVmStatus>
    <edgeVmStatus>
      <edgeVMStatus>GREEN</edgeVMStatus>
      <haState>active</haState>
      <index>0</index>
      <id>vm-358</id>
      <name>test2-0</name>
    </edgeVmStatus>
    <edgeVmStatus>
      <edgeVMStatus>GREEN</edgeVMStatus>
      <haState>active</haState>
      <index>1</index>
      <id>vm-362</id>
      <name>test2-1</name>
    </edgeVmStatus>
  </edgeVmStatus>
  <featureStatuses>
    <featureStatus>
      <service>loadBalancer</service>
      <configured>false</configured>
      <serverStatus>down</serverStatus>
    </featureStatus>
    <featureStatus>
      <service>dhcp</service>
      <configured>true</configured>
      <publishStatus>Applied</publishStatus>
      <serverStatus>up</serverStatus>
    </featureStatus>
    <featureStatus>
      <service>sslvpn</service>
      <configured>false</configured>
      <serverStatus>down</serverStatus>
    </featureStatus>
    <featureStatus>
      <service>syslog</service>
      <configured>false</configured>
      <serverStatus>up</serverStatus>
    </featureStatus>
    <featureStatus>
      <service>nat</service>
      <configured>false</configured>
    </featureStatus>
    <featureStatus>
      <service>dns</service>
      <configured>false</configured>
      <serverStatus>down</serverStatus>
    </featureStatus>
    <featureStatus>
      <service>ipsec</service>
      <configured>false</configured>
      <serverStatus>down</serverStatus>
    </featureStatus>
    <featureStatus>
      <service>firewall</service>
      <configured>true</configured>
      <publishStatus>Applied</publishStatus>
    </featureStatus>
    <featureStatus>
      <service>staticRouting</service>
      <configured>false</configured>
    </featureStatus>
    <featureStatus>
      <service>highAvailability</service>
      <configured>true</configured>
      <publishStatus>Applied</publishStatus>
      <serverStatus>up</serverStatus>
    </featureStatus>
  </featureStatuses>
</edgeStatus>

Working With NSX Edge Summary

GET /4.0/edges/{edgeId}/summary

Retrieve details about the specified NSX Edge.

Method history:

Release Modification
6.3.0 Method updated. enableFips parameter added to appliancesSummary.

Responses

200 OK

Response Example (application/xml)
